body_html:
I'm not sure if the issue is entirely the same as with ConferencePreferences @branquinhoaa ? The only attribute that is kind of "interfering" with a simple solution (one ConferenceOffer for one Conference) is the orga comment.

But for me there are still some open questions:

  1. What's the orga comment for? (cc @mkalininait)
  2. Who can see the orga comment? I suppose the team will see it later on as a hint on why they've been chosen, telling them they'll receive more infos for their talk, etc.
  3. Is the orga comment relevant before the ConferenceOffer is created / visible to students? I suppose not.

All in all - please correct me if I'm totally off @mkalininait - the comment is going to be optional and is not related to the combination of Conferences the team chose in their ConferencePreference, but to a single Conference out of their preferences they're then offered to go to.
It's also most likely, that a team will simply get a single ConferenceOffer for one Conference outta the two they chose in their ConferencePreference.

The mental model for the ConferenceOffer would then be: have all the conference-tuples from the teams' ConferencePreferences as a base data to decide which Team to give which ConferenceOffers. Therefore, the ConferenceOffer needs a 1x1 association with a Conference, but does not stand in any association with the ConferencePreference object from the team.
This idea could even be extended to: a team can get a ConferenceOffer for a Conference they did not even mention in their ConferencePreference.

Given that, I think your 2nd approach sounds best 👍

Feel fee to ping me if anything about the ☝️ is unclear or if I got something wrong.

body:
I'm not sure if the issue is entirely the same as with `ConferencePreferences` @branquinhoaa ? The only attribute that is kind of _"interfering"_ with a simple solution (one `ConferenceOffer` for one `Conference`) is the orga comment.

But for me there are still some open questions:
1. What's the orga comment for? (cc @mkalininait)
1. Who can see the orga comment? I suppose the team will see it later on as a hint on why they've been chosen, telling them they'll receive more infos for their talk, etc.
1. Is the orga comment relevant **before** the `ConferenceOffer` is created / visible to students? I suppose not.

All in all - please correct me if I'm totally off @mkalininait - the comment is going to be **optional** and is not related to the combination of `Conferences` the team chose in their `ConferencePreference`, but to a **single `Conference`** out of their preferences they're then offered to go to.
It's also most likely, that a team will simply get a single `ConferenceOffer` for one `Conference` outta the two they chose in their `ConferencePreference`.

The mental model for the `ConferenceOffer` would then be: have all the conference-tuples from the teams' `ConferencePreferences` as a base data to decide which Team to give which `ConferenceOffers`. Therefore, the `ConferenceOffer` needs a 1x1 association with a `Conference`, but **does not stand in any association** with the `ConferencePreference` object from the team.
This idea could even be extended to: a team can get a `ConferenceOffer` for a `Conference` they did not even mention in their `ConferencePreference`.

Given that, I think your 2nd approach sounds best 👍 

Feel fee to ping me if anything about the ☝️ is unclear or if I got something wrong.
